name: Hiding?
description:
Lowpoly hide and seek game.

You are character in a dreamworld.. or in reality. Your mission is to wake up.. or go to sleep? To solve this mystery you need to collect hidden pieces of a broken painting. 

There are 9 (only 7 has to be collected) pieces randomly hidden in house. Your objective is to search them and get those pieces one by one to the painting to make it full. This task however is not easy because there’s someone in the house who makes your treasure hunt more difficult.

Obviously this creature chases you so there are multiple hidden places in house (cupboards,/bed/tables) where you can be safe. This creature chasing you has poor eyesight, but it can hear you better. Even if you don't have time to hide, just don't make noise.

Happy hiding.

Controls:

WASD - move

Shift - Run

Left mouse - Search/ take item

E - Open doors/Hide

  • Tutorial is only shown once, so don't worry to view it every start.

Tips/Hints

  • You can only carry one piece at a time to the painting/board.
  • The monster can't go straight from the closet door to the bedroom and vice versa.
    • By standing near to your bed and bedside table you'll be safe no matter what.
  • Sometimes it is best to move backwards. It’s slower, but it doesn’t take time to turn around and you can start running away from monster right away.

Updates 10/7

  • Boxes and doors are more visible
  •  Bedroom - hallway entrance wall is now visible when player enters hallway
  • Difficulty levels are updated: easy is much easier and nightmare is more "nightmarish"
